content: Update on sales tax projections and how much Erie County government could lose.  It all depends on how much our largest source of revenue decreases because of the Coronavirus pandemic.  It makes the Red-Green budget crisis look like a walk in the park. https://t.co/vPsIuFAFR3 https://t.co/oUFOmedBBv
Hearts are heavy across Buffalo as we mourn the loss of Don Allen Jr.  Ashley and I express our heartfelt condolences to his family. https://t.co/AMw5OwRv1b

My mission as your Taxpayer Watchdog during this crisis is “service over self:” providing decisive, steady and measured leadership.  I’m calmly and confidently leading our county through these difficult times.https://t.co/dljmZgmhIs

I'm thrilled for Michael Caputo. At this time he is not able to discuss his appointment by President Trump. He did ask me to speak for his family. Michael told me it wasn’t a hard decision. When the President called him, he saluted and packed up his things.https://t.co/Yj3u9TKfV6

Many stimulus checks have been direct deposited into bank accounts. However, if you have not yet received your rebate, the feds created a new web tool called “Get My Payment.” It’s meant to help get your relief payment faster.  https://t.co/iI8OKAll3F

Ashley& I ordered dinner Tuesday night from Major Tom’s in Hamburg.Owned by 3 brothers,all who have served in the military.  Just like other small businesses, they’re struggling. Let’s support our hurting restaurants, especially those owned by veterans.

https://t.co/KblcIcnKMG
I would be proud to vote for this in the House as part of the incoming class of Republican Congress members that take back the gavel from Nancy Pelosi. Cc: @TuckerCarlson https://t.co/JmMG622BtW
Top photo: Maksym and Emeryk being told it is Dyngus Day. Bottom photo: reaction when notified all parades, dinners, dancing and events are postponed. https://t.co/JWhua5khdI

It was an honor to know Tom. We thank him for his service to our great nation as a Vietnam War vet. He was a conservative champion that fought for our shared values..
https://t.co/Pg3a69xTp1
From the Mychajliw family to yours: have a blessed and safe Easter Sunday! We pray for new beginnings, rebirth and rejoicing during these challenging times. https://t.co/OTTjP1BR1S

Best memories of my Baba: making coffee with an “old fashioned” percolator. Our Keurig stopped working. So I bought my own percolator. Takes more time to make. Coffee is much better. https://t.co/CkF16Vvymu

Some good news during a time of financial concern. My Office's Supplier Pay Program through M&T Bank has brought in the most revenue to date. This is positive news as we brace for revenue loss due to the Covid-19 pandemic shutdown. https://t.co/5hteqB1ARX

Heartbreaking. I knew Eli well. One of my first stories as a journalist. Street musician in & around Syracuse University. Lived on those streets & owned them with his presence. Senseless hit and run. Community mourns a beautiful soul. Horrible how he died. https://t.co/xOTmSSC6ks

Participated in 1st ever live video conference committee mtg in the history of the Erie Co. Leg.  We received a COVID-19 update.This could be the "new norm" for future https://t.co/MIUiDLLqPM team is doing incredibly productive work from outside the office..not missing a beat. https://t.co/iXdjmVZ7LC

I reached out to every member of Congress in NYS. In the next stimulus bill, EC needs assistance offsetting what we anticipate is going to be a big reduction in sales tax revenue. I pledge to work with Democrats & Republicans to help counties manage. https://t.co/16LNwKXTff https://t.co/MYV3Z9JhFr

This is the right call. When local health care professionals stated there would be no ventilators to spare, I strongly opposed Governor Cuomo’s ill advised order to have the National Guard seize medical equipment here to be used in New York City. 

https://t.co/7MLfLOF6h5 https://t.co/9x7VjZGNCf

Our report answering your questions about filing for unemployment, what the benefits are and how can small businesses apply for federal help under the CARES Act. Click here: https://t.co/R4LThvTJm6 https://t.co/kMCrqhP836

Once we get through the health care crisis surrounding COVID-19, I pledge to work in a bi-partisan manner to get us through a potential economic crisis.Right now we are in solid shape.There’s $102.5 million in our “rainy day” account.  We also have $235 million in cash. https://t.co/m0mnyaF2MT

Chris Jacobs must apologize. This false claim is reckless. Elected leaders need to work together to stop Governor Cuomo. People deserve measured leadership. Even worse: Jacobs voted against paid leave for people that lost their job because of the Coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/yXPfjeAO05

The Gov’s Executive Order threatening the use of the National Guard to confiscate medical equip. here for use in NYC is wrong. Our apex of the Coronavirus curve might be 1 week or 3 weeks from now. We should utilize the County Attorney or even the Sheriff’s Office to fight this https://t.co/sjoxtBpDY5

The CARES Act stimulus bill provides $159 million to Erie Co.With strings attached. It must be spent directly on Coronavirus expenses.The problem: we cannot use the funds to offset losses of sales tax revenue.I reached out to Senators Schumer &Gillibrand..https://t.co/kUJxtLGuAm
If we are looking for positive news or light at the end of the tunnel during these trying times, this might be it: https://t.co/attX9E22K1

If sales tax revenue drops 50% between March and June, that represents $80 million of lost revenue to Erie County. To put things in perspective, we pay just a little more than that for libraries, parks, Sheriffs' Police Services, cultural funding and road repairs combined. https://t.co/zBJoXcjshH

My message to hotels and motels: government will not punitively punish you during this painful time. I’m waiving Hotel Occupancy Tax penalties, which would have been passed on to customers or worse, remaining workers. https://t.co/r4GUSIeFK9

Businesses are hurting, especially hotels.That’s why I’m waiving penalties for hotels/motels that were late paying Hotel Occupancy Tax.These penalties would have been passed on to the consumer or remaining workers on hotel payrolls.   https://t.co/z3UE5I2j2x

WNY has always stepped up in times of crisis.  In Hamburg, a great community where I live, there is an effort underway to help those who are really struggling through this Pandemic. You can donate items, or give financially through the @feedhamburg Venmo account. https://t.co/fckQvREhSW

The impact of the Coronavirus Pandemic has hit small businesses hard.I am proud to live in the Village of Hamburg, home to many great locally owned businesses.  It’s wonderful to support them if you can. We picked up some delicious movie theatre popcorn from The Palace Theatre. https://t.co/eMyxz1PBCY
Maksym can’t get a haircut. Most definitely could use one. No such styling issues for Emeryk. https://t.co/Sv0cl7jeM1

The Coronavirus crisis is impacting our community in countless ways. Cities, towns,villages &school districts in Erie Co. will be hurt by an expected loss in sales tax revenue. My office did an analysis of best and worst-case scenarios. https://t.co/ATmMwn8bn3
Emeryk Francis turns eight months old during the height of some crazy, turbulent times. So here’s a video of our eight month old baby boy laughing hysterically. https://t.co/WuTSMM8UjX

Beware of online scams involving the sale of fraudulent Coronavirus "home test kits."  Unscrupulous scum are trying to rip you off.  Listen to your doctor on your need to get tested in a safe, medically supervised environment.  Home test kits are bogus.https://t.co/6LmXtF8UHy

I concur with my neighbor in the Village of Hamburg: we can never adequately thank those on the front lines of this Coronavirus crisis. Thank you to everyone doing their part at home, at hospitals or in the workplace. https://t.co/Rl4lYELVE1

While the Rath Building is fairly empty, our county employees are working incredibly hard around the clock here and at locations outside the office. Many thanks to all county employees for continuing to serve taxpayers under very challenging circumstances. https://t.co/OQD4F8hBbM
I hope and pray this Nobel laureate and Stanford biophysicist is correct:https://t.co/ZRR6CBvFJG

Our analysis shows county finances could be crippled in the months ahead, depending on the possible percentage of sales tax losses. A 50% drop in sales tax revenue up until June could result in a loss of $80 million.  https://t.co/XowIiAzRUH

There is a shortage of Coronavirus test kits. I have a solution. I proposed cutting 4 jobs in my office & replacing them with 2, saving $32,000. I’m calling on the Legislature to pass my office reorg & use the savings to buy Coronavirus test kits. https://t.co/TKIJddoTAd

It has been reported that there is a blood shortage across the country and here at home because of the Coronavirus outbreak.  If you are able, please donate. https://t.co/6Qn4ySuIEt.                https://t.co/EOKJkdow9H

Vendors we work with are being paid in a timely manner thanks to an electronic invoice & pymnt system my team worked hard putting in place.
https://t.co/FjXelGoMQJ

“Please share our post. Spread the good word so your re-usable bag doesn’t spread viral and bacteria diseases. They need to be washed regularly to stop to spread of disease.”

https://t.co/xIV07CQh1z

We expect a potential decline in salex tax the months ahead.  EC, towns, cities, villages, school districts & the NFTA will be impacted.  I’m putting these entities on notice: brace yourselves.  I will keep them informed as soon as we receive data from NYS
https://t.co/odCy78FaZI

The world has become quite a scary and concerning place the past few weeks. So I’m simply sharing great pics of the boys to avoid anything related to Coronavirus or politics. #washyourhands https://t.co/tG0HO6P8au

Helpful information in here for small business owners. Facebook launched a “Business Resource Hub” to help businesses effectively manage & overcome challenges in wake of #COVID19 https://t.co/77OxlKWwZ9

I went to the store to buy diapers &formula for our boys. Most shelves: empty. Panic & fear. Scammers will try to take advantage of us during this Coronavirus https://t.co/fMtwVovGG8 taxpayer watchdog I’m sharing tips on how to protect yourself:     https://t.co/IovpmXwc9X

We have a great workforce in Erie County government. In these times of heightened awareness, I want to make sure all of them are getting paid on a timely basis no matter the circumstances. https://t.co/hnGl1Oo3Q7

Is it possible the global reaction to this disease is blown out of proportion?  Yes. Regardless of the reaction, global, national, state and local finances will be impacted. Erie County government needs to be prepared to manage the financial repercussions.https://t.co/Fpvz6pYzM9

It is wrong that Gov Cuomo & Albany politicians, through wasteful spending, created a $6B+ budget gap. They want counties to clean up their mess. Forcing families to plug Albany’s deficits by shoving higher Medicaid bills down our throats is not right. https://t.co/WnMAhHRRUX

Met with Pastor Deborah Turley of Lord of Life Lutheran Church in Depew about the wonderful work they do w/ the Depew Community Action Team; they provide day care & adult day care &once a month-with Matthews Table-they provide free dinner for the community. https://t.co/V2UkOgm6qn

Congratulations to former Congressman Mark Meadows on his appointment as President Trump’s new Chief of Staff. The former Freedom Caucus Chairman and yours truly had a nice breakfast in DC last year. https://t.co/6vmKykJrN7

Thanks to Graycliff Exec. Dir. Anna Kaplan for the tour of the Frank Lloyd Wright gem in Derby. So much progress has been made in the restoration. Erie Co. residents, admission and tours are half off in March.Go to https://t.co/QfF4RTYrJw use code ERIEGC https://t.co/4oxapBHUsT

It’s cold. Blustery. 100% chance of rain. Perfect time to go door to door in NY27. Legs are soaked. Can easily wring out my jeans. No one will out work me. Earning every single vote. https://t.co/tnIB34WiNU

Grateful to the Constitutional Coalition of NYS for having me on their radio program last night on WJJL. Thank you to hosts Mark Constantino and Nancy Orticelli for the great conversation. https://t.co/QHW50LmyJy

Thanks to a strong economy in 2019, sales tax revenue collected in Erie County was higher than anticipated.  See link for info:
https://t.co/LCh6WmfmfM
